\section{Editor.js - Block-Style Editor}
\href{https://editorjs.io/}{Editor.js} is a block-styled editor that returns clean JSON data instead
of heavy HTML markup.\par
\subsection{Why Editor.js?}
Editor.js takes a unique approach to content editing:\par
\begin{itemize}
  \item \textbf{Block-based} - Each paragraph, heading, or image is a block

  \item \textit{Clean output} - Returns structured JSON, not messy HTML

  \item \underline{Extensible} - Add custom blocks via plugins

  \item Minimal and fast - No dependencies, lightweight core
\end{itemize}
\subsection{Output Format}
Instead of HTML, Editor.js outputs clean JSON data:\par \begin{verbatim}{
  "blocks": [
    {
      "type": "header",
      "data": { "text": "Hello", "level": 2 }
    }
  ]
}\end{verbatim}
\subsection{Available Plugins}
Many plugins are available for different content types:\par
\begin{enumerate}
  \item Headers and paragraphs

  \item Lists (ordered and unordered)

  \item Images and embeds

  \item Tables and code blocks

  \item Quotes and delimiters
\end{enumerate}
\begin{quote}
  "Editor.js is designed to be used in modern web applications where content quality matters."\par
\end{quote}Visit \href{https://github.com/codex-team/editor.js}{GitHub} for installation
instructions.\par \par
